intro: Microlicia hispidula, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Microlicia hispidula is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
